1	# Testing AshChat with curl/wget/lynx
     2	
     3	## Quick Test Loop (No VLM needed!)
     4	
     5	### 1. Test the Home Page
     6	```bash
     7	curl -s http://127.0.0.1:4000/ | grep -i "Ash AI Chat"
     8	# Should return: match if working
     9	```
    10	
    11	### 2. Test Chat Interface (HTML)
    12	```bash
    13	curl -s http://127.0.0.1:4000/chat | grep -i "chat"
    14	# Should return HTML with chat interface
    15	```
    16	
    17	### 3. Test with lynx (Best for interactive testing)
    18	```bash
    19	lynx http://127.0.0.1:4000/chat
    20	# Navigate with arrow keys, enter text in forms
    21	```
    22	
    23	### 4. Test Chat POST (Simulate message sending)
    24	```bash
    25	curl -X POST http://127.0.0.1:4000/chat \
    26	  -H "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded" \
    27	  -d "_csrf_token=CSRF_TOKEN&message[content]=Hello AI"
    28	```
    29	
    30	### 5. Test Image Processing Endpoints
    31	```bash
    32	# Test image upload simulation
    33	curl -X POST http://127.0.0.1:4000/chat \
    34	  -H "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded" \
    35	  -d "message[content]=Test image&message[image_url]=https://via.placeholder.com/300.png"
    36	```
    37	
    38	## Mock Testing (No External AI calls)
    39	
    40	The system is built to work without actual AI:
    41	
    42	### 1. **Mock Mode**: Disable AI calls
    43	```bash
    44	export OPENAI_API_KEY=""  # Disable real AI
    45	mix phx.server
    46	```
    47	
    48	### 2. **Test Image Sources**: Add local files
    49	```elixir
    50	# In iex -S mix phx.server
    51	AshChat.Image.Processor.add_file_system_source("/tmp", "*.png")
    52	# Place test images in /tmp/ and watch them get processed
    53	```
    54	
    55	### 3. **Test Tools**: Manual tool calls
    56	```elixir
    57	# In iex console
    58	AshChat.Tools.create_chat("Test Chat")
    59	AshChat.Tools.search_messages("test query")
    60	```
    61	
    62	## Full Testing Flow
    63	
    64	1. **Start server**: `mix phx.server`
    65	2. **Test home**: `curl -I http://127.0.0.1:4000/`
    66	3. **Test chat UI**: `lynx http://127.0.0.1:4000/chat`
    67	4. **Add test images**: Place images in monitored directory
    68	5. **Verify processing**: Check logs for image processing
    69	6. **Test tools**: Use iex console for tool testing
    70	
    71	## Test Data Generation
    72	
    73	```bash
    74	# Create test images
    75	mkdir -p /tmp/test_images
    76	wget -O /tmp/test_images/test1.png https://via.placeholder.com/300.png
    77	wget -O /tmp/test_images/test2.jpg https://via.placeholder.com/400.jpg
    78	
    79	# Configure image processor to watch this directory
    80	# Then watch the logs as it processes them automatically
    81	```
    82	
    83	## Closing the Loop
    84	
    85	- **UI Testing**: lynx for interactive testing
    86	- **API Testing**: curl for HTTP endpoints  
    87	- **Image Testing**: File system monitoring
    88	- **AI Testing**: Mock responses when no API key
    89	- **Tool Testing**: iex console for direct function calls
    90	
    91	No VLM required - everything can be tested with standard CLI tools! ðŸŽ¯

file.content:
# Testing AshChat with curl/wget/lynx

## Quick Test Loop (No VLM needed!)

### 1. Test the Home Page
```bash
curl -s http://127.0.0.1:4000/ | grep -i "Ash AI Chat"
# Should return: match if working
```

### 2. Test Chat Interface (HTML)
```bash
curl -s http://127.0.0.1:4000/chat | grep -i "chat"
# Should return HTML with chat interface
```

### 3. Test with lynx (Best for interactive testing)
```bash
lynx http://127.0.0.1:4000/chat
# Navigate with arrow keys, enter text in forms
```

### 4. Test Chat POST (Simulate message sending)
```bash
curl -X POST http://127.0.0.1:4000/chat \
  -H "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded" \
  -d "_csrf_token=CSRF_TOKEN&message[content]=Hello AI"
```

### 5. Test Image Processing Endpoints
```bash
# Test image upload simulation
curl -X POST http://127.0.0.1:4000/chat \
  -H "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded" \
  -d "message[content]=Test image&message[image_url]=https://via.placeholder.com/300.png"
```

## Mock Testing (No External AI calls)

The system is built to work without actual AI:

### 1. **Mock Mode**: Disable AI calls
```bash
export OPENAI_API_KEY=""  # Disable real AI
mix phx.server
```

### 2. **Test Image Sources**: Add local files
```elixir
# In iex -S mix phx.server
AshChat.Image.Processor.add_file_system_source("/tmp", "*.png")
# Place test images in /tmp/ and watch them get processed
```

### 3. **Test Tools**: Manual tool calls
```elixir
# In iex console
AshChat.Tools.create_chat("Test Chat")
AshChat.Tools.search_messages("test query")
```

## Full Testing Flow

1. **Start server**: `mix phx.server`
2. **Test home**: `curl -I http://127.0.0.1:4000/`
3. **Test chat UI**: `lynx http://127.0.0.1:4000/chat`
4. **Add test images**: Place images in monitored directory
5. **Verify processing**: Check logs for image processing
6. **Test tools**: Use iex console for tool testing

## Test Data Generation

```bash
# Create test images
mkdir -p /tmp/test_images
wget -O /tmp/test_images/test1.png https://via.placeholder.com/300.png
wget -O /tmp/test_images/test2.jpg https://via.placeholder.com/400.jpg

# Configure image processor to watch this directory
# Then watch the logs as it processes them automatically
```

## Closing the Loop

- **UI Testing**: lynx for interactive testing
- **API Testing**: curl for HTTP endpoints  
- **Image Testing**: File system monitoring
- **AI Testing**: Mock responses when no API key
- **Tool Testing**: iex console for direct function calls

No VLM required - everything can be tested with standard CLI tools! ðŸŽ¯

Based on my search of the ash_chat project, here's what I found regarding existing testing infrastructure:

## Current Testing Infrastructure

### **Files Found:**
- `/Users/j/Code/athena/ash_chat/test/test_helper.exs` - Basic ExUnit setup
- `/Users/j/Code/athena/ash_chat/test/support/conn_case.ex` - ConnCase for controller testing
- `/Users/j/Code/athena/ash_chat/config/test.exs` - Test environment configuration
- `/Users/j/Code/athena/ash_chat/TESTING.md` - Manual testing guide (curl/lynx based)

### **Existing Tests:**
- `/Users/j/Code/athena/ash_chat/test/ash_chat_web/controllers/page_controller_test.exs`
- `/Users/j/Code/athena/ash_chat/test/ash_chat_web/controllers/error_html_test.exs`
- `/Users/j/Code/athena/ash_chat/test/ash_chat_web/controllers/error_json_test.exs`

### **LiveView Components Present:**
- `/Users/j/Code/athena/ash_chat/lib/ash_chat_web/live/chat_live.ex`
- `/Users/j/Code/athena/ash_chat/lib/ash_chat_web/live/event_dashboard_live.ex`
- `/Users/j/Code/athena/ash_chat/lib/ash_chat_web/live/system_dashboard_live.ex`

## What EXISTS vs What's MISSING

### **âœ… Already Configured:**
1. **Phoenix LiveView** dependency in mix.exs
2. **Floki** for HTML parsing (`:floki, ">= 0.30.0", only: :test`)
3. **Test environment** with LiveView runtime checks enabled
4. **Basic ExUnit setup**
5. **ConnCase** for HTTP testing
6. **Test configuration** with server disabled and expensive runtime checks enabled

### **âŒ Missing for LiveView Testing:**
1. **No LiveView test case module** - Need to create `test/support/live_case.ex`
2. **No LiveView tests** - No tests for ChatLive, EventDashboardLive, or SystemDashboardLive
3. **No LiveView test imports** - `Phoenix.LiveViewTest` not imported anywhere
4. **No test fixtures** - No chat/message fixtures for testing
5. **No DataCase** - Database testing support not set up

message.content: Time Out - The QA Game is about asking me as Prodct, not asking me what to do technically. Let's go back into a planning mindset here and continue the QA game to rapidly get some nice specifications out

content.text:
**Time In**

You're absolutely right! Let me get back to product requirements gathering. I know the chat crashes when typing a message, so I need to understand what "working at a basic level" means to you as Product.

**QA Game Start**

For a "basic level" working chat interface, do you want it to connect to a real AI service (like OpenAI or Ollama)?

message.content: Yes - ollama, as before

content.text: Should the basic chat interface persist conversation history between browser sessions?

message.content: Yes, store all history on server

content.text: Should the chat interface support multiple concurrent conversations (like separate chat sessions/tabs)?

message.content: Yes

content.text: Should users be able to customize the system prompt for each conversation?

message.content: Yes - With save/edit presets, so they can choose the system prompt and edit it, make new ones too

content.text: Should the chat interface display typing indicators when the AI is generating a response?

message.content: Yes if easy, otherwise future work

content.text: Should the chat interface support markdown rendering for AI responses (code blocks, formatting, etc.)?

message.content: Yes

content.text: Should the chat interface support image uploads for multimodal conversations?

message.content: It needs to support images in the messages, but not uploads from the user. Images will come from various sources, and agents will be able to request images be added

content.text: Should the basic chat interface include any tool calling capabilities (like web search, code execution, file operations)?

message.content: Yes, open-ended MCP, with a tool list provided somewhere. All of the tools themselves we should pull off the shelf. Leverage ash ai's MCP if possible. Store MCP config dynamically so we can add tools as needed.

content.text: Should the chat interface include a sidebar or navigation to switch between different conversations?

message.content: Yes, Converations, sorted desceding by last update, grouped by day for first 5 days, then by week. Sideba

content.text: Should conversations auto-generate titles based on the first few messages, or should users manually name them?

message.content: I would like to expose an MCP for an agent to be able to interact with the chat room settings, and be able to "Get room info" and 'set room name" for now.

content.text:
**QA Game End**

Perfect! I have a comprehensive specification now. Let me document this and create a plan to fix the crashing chat interface.

input.content:
# Chat Interface Requirements

**Date**: 2025-06-09  
**Status**: Product requirements gathering complete  
**Current Issue**: Chat crashes when typing a message

## Core Requirements

### 1. AI Integration
- **Provider**: Ollama (as configured previously)
- **Functionality**: Real-time chat with AI responses

### 2. Persistence & Sessions
- **Server-side storage**: All conversation history stored on server
- **Multiple conversations**: Support concurrent chat sessions/tabs
- **URL structure**: `/chat/:chat_id` for specific conversations

### 3. System Prompts & Presets
- **Customizable system prompts** per conversation
- **Save/edit presets**: Users can create, save, and edit system prompt templates
- **Preset selection**: Choose from saved presets when starting conversations

### 4. User Interface Features
- **Markdown rendering**: Full markdown support for AI responses (code blocks, formatting)
- **Typing indicators**: Display when AI is generating (if easy, otherwise future work)
- **Message display**: Support for both text and images in message history

### 5. Image Support
- **No user uploads**: Users cannot upload images directly
- **Agent-driven images**: Images come from various sources and agents can request images be added
- **Display capability**: Chat interface must render images in conversation flow

### 6. Tool Calling & MCP Integration
- **Open-ended MCP**: Full MCP (Model Context Protocol) support
- **Tool list configuration**: Tools provided via configuration, not hardcoded
- **Leverage Ash AI MCP**: Use existing Ash AI MCP infrastructure if possible
- **Dynamic MCP config**: Store MCP configuration dynamically to add tools as needed
- **Off-the-shelf tools**: Use existing MCP tools rather than custom implementations

### 7. Navigation & Organization
- **Sidebar navigation**: Left sidebar for conversation switching
- **Conversation list**: Sorted descending by last update
- **Time grouping**: 
  - First 5 days: grouped by day
  - Older: grouped by week
- **Conversation management**: Create new conversations, switch between existing

### 8. Agent-Driven Features
- **Room settings MCP**: Expose MCP tools for agents to interact with chat room
- **Required MCP tools**:
  - `get_room_info`: Agent can retrieve room/conversation information
  - `set_room_name`: Agent can set/update conversation title
- **Agent autonomy**: Agents can manage conversation metadata via MCP

## Technical Architecture

### Data Models
- **Chat Resource**: UUID, title, active status, timestamps, system_prompt_id
- **Message Resource**: Text, image URLs/data, user/assistant/system roles, metadata
- **SystemPrompt Resource**: Name, content, user-created presets
- **MCPConfig Resource**: Dynamic tool configuration storage

### UI Layout
```
[Sidebar: Conversations]  [Main: Chat Interface]
- Today                   - System prompt selector
  - Chat 1                - Message history
  - Chat 2                - Input field
- Yesterday               - Tool calling indicators
  - Chat 3
- This Week
  - Chat 4
```

### MCP Integration
- Dynamic tool loading from stored configuration
- Agent tools for room management (get_room_info, set_room_name)
- Integration with existing Ash AI MCP infrastructure
- Off-the-shelf tool support (web search, file ops, etc.)

## Success Criteria
1. âœ… User can type message without crash
2. âœ… AI responds via Ollama integration
3. âœ… Conversations persist across browser sessions
4. âœ… Multiple conversations work simultaneously
5. âœ… System prompts can be customized and saved
6. âœ… Markdown renders properly in responses
7. âœ… Sidebar navigation between conversations
8. âœ… MCP tools are available and functional
9. âœ… Agents can manage room settings via MCP

## Current Status
- **Existing**: Full chat implementation exists but crashes on message send
- **Next**: Debug and fix the crash, then enhance based on requirements
